attributes.action: Make height discrimination against the law
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This proposal is all about making heightism against the law, preventing people using height as a way of discriminating. Daily people experience heightism but can’t do anything about it. Examples are; 

1) Jobs – who gets them, earning or promotional potential.
2) Sports – most favour tall or average height people; short people are left on the sidelines.
3) Bullying (can include use of derogatory terms to ridicule e.g. ‘midget’ or ‘shrimp’) – in school, work, home or when you’re out. 
4) People are treated differently by stature, regardless of age.  
5) Clothing/shoes - not all shops offer petite sizes, shorter/longer garment length or bigger/smaller shoe sizes.
6) Height is used as a way to define or judge someone; people see height before anything else. 

This campaign is very important because people should have the right to be treated equally not differently just because of their stature. Other types of discrimination are not allowed, so it should be the same for height discrimination.
